title: EU consumers back call for more stringent eco-labels on confectionery and other food products - ConfectioneryNews.com
summary: The European Commission is considering proposals to stamp out misleading environmental claims. A survey by EIT Food found that 67% of Europeans would use a universal, independent, and factually substantiated label for sustainable food products.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes the development of a 'Product Environmental Footprint' methodology to calculate the environmental impact of a product over its lifetime and a ban on the introduction of new public labelling schemes unless developed at the EU level, which are both green innovations.

title: Nestlé invests £7 million into new hard-to-recycle plastics plant - FoodNavigator.com
summary: Nestlé is investing £7 million into Impact Recycling, a company that has developed a breakthrough plastic recycling technology. The new recycling plant will be operational in late Summer 2024 and will have the capacity to take 25,000 tonnes of flexible plastic, which means it has the potential to recycle more than the amount of flexible plastic packaging Nestlé UK and Ireland places on the market.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the innovation is a new recycling technology that will help to reduce the environmental impact of plastic packaging waste.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the innovation is a new recycling technology that will improve recycling capacity for flexible packaging.
green_product: FALSE, because the article does not describe a specific green product.
green_process: TRUE, because the article describes a new recycling technology that will help to reduce the environmental impact of plastic packaging waste.

title: PepsiCo pushes entrepreneurial collaboration as 'vital' APAC sustainability strategy - FoodNavigator-Asia.com
summary: PepsiCo ran the Greenhouse Accelerator Programme in the APAC region for the first time. Powered Carbon won the competition with their carbon capture technology that can be used to reduce emissions in fertilizer production, which is a key component in PepsiCo's supply chain. Powered Carbon will use the prize money to further develop their product.
likely_naics_codes: ['325199', 'All Other Chemicals and Allied Products Manufacturing', '3251', 'Chemicals Manufacturing']

title: Global Denim Jeans Strategic Market Report 2023-2030 - Denim Enters Dynamic Times with Innovations to Push ... - GlobeNewswire
summary: The global denim jeans market was valued at $70.1 million in 2022, and is projected to reach $114.6 million by 2030, growing at a CAGR of 6.3%. The market is driven by factors such as the increasing popularity of denim jeans as a fashion item across all genders and age groups, the growing demand for sustainable and ethical fashion products, and the rising disposable income in developing regions. However, the market is also facing challenges such as the increasing popularity of athleisure wear and the threat from substitutes.

title: Mars rethinks recipes, ingredients on journey to Net Zero - FoodNavigator.com
summary: Mars Inc. has committed to reach net zero emissions across its full value chain by 2050. Ingredient innovation and product reformulation are two tools Mars is leveraging to achieve its net zero goal. Mars is working with Perfect Day to develop animal-free dairy protein, which has a lower environmental impact than traditional dairy production.
green_innovation: TRUE. Mars is developing new ingredients with lower greenhouse gas (GHG)-footprints for snacks and human food dishes, as well as alternative proteins for pet food. These innovations are designed to reduce the environmental impact of Mars' products.
business_innovation: TRUE. Mars is using precise fermentation to develop allulose, a natural sugar substitute, more affordable and accessible. This technological innovation could reduce the environmental impact of Mars' products.
green_product: TRUE. CO2COA is a lactose-free milk chocolate brand made with Rainforest Alliance certified cocoa and sold in 83% fibre-based packaging. CO2COA is an example of a green product because it is designed to reduce the environmental impact of its production and packaging.
green_process: TRUE. Mars is working with its dairy suppliers to reduce the footprint of its dairy supply by 50% by 2023 through on-farm interventions. These interventions are designed to reduce the environmental impact of dairy production.
